alert.note: Alert for Liberty (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 12:08AM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Liberty and Toole. * WHEN...Until 145 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1202 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated continued rainfall. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitlash. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
